Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget and needed a room for a couple of nights. This hotel felt like a dorm. Small cramped rooms that could have used better cleaning. Good location but Go look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “its only good for one day or for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: Tourchwoodtours
Reviews.Content: oxford hotel is like a 2 star hotel charging like a 3 star hotel. some of the staff are commodious, but other are not. our room is badly cut. were sleeping in this narrow space were the bathroom doors looked like some storage closet or the doors to the TARDIS. also the locks on the bathroom doors did not lock. it's not broken just an example of bad engineering. that place is not near everything. we had to walk afar to find a good eating place. the only thing i love is the vending machine on every floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Harshawardhan
Reviews.Content: The Oxford hotel is situated in a the center of this city state. This is a very reasonable place to stay while in Singapore. The breakfast which was inclusive with the room was not to my liking otherwise the rooms were quite neat and clean. This is a small hotel but for business and budget travelers who do not want to spend much time in the hotel this is a great place. Going for a conference to Singapore ? check this place for discounts. Very close to the SunTec Center.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: wzahk
Reviews.Content: I can see why some reviewers called this place a Nightmare. I was in Singapore last week as an official for the Mettle Games, this was the official hotel that the organizer arranged for the athletes & officials. The location as other reviewers here mentioned, is quite good. However, as with the case with many hotels in Singapore, I felt it was rather over-priced for what you are actually getting. First of all, the rooms are very run down & small. The carpet & bathroom had stains; the towels provided seemed very old & worn out. When I checked in, I was given a room on the 2nd floor; at the end of the corridor of the 2nd floor was the hotel's office of some sort, so there was a lot of traffic outside my door. My room's air-conditioner was not working, so the hotel manager (Mr. Jason) came by & checked it; he popped the cover off the A/C controller & tried to do some adjustments to the a/c but the A/C was still not working right. He then kindly offered to change my room. A few minutes later, I was showed another room on the 2nd floor, Room 201 - it had Air con, but no windows!! ( all '01' rooms in this hotel has NO window). I was then showed the same room I originally had, but on the 9th floor. The room was exactly the same but the AC seemed to work. Some 'Security' issues i had with this hotel;- - All the rooms i viewed & stayed in, the security chain/bar on the door of the rooms were broken. Looked like someone pushed the door in from the outside & broke the bar. On the doors itself, you can see the damage on the wooden doorframe & where the bars have been before & subsequently re-installed. - The room I stayed in, had an in-room safe; but the electronic keypad-front plate of the safe was missing, looked like it was broken off... the safe was locked & it had a piece of paper with "out of order" stuck on it. When I called the front desk to ask if they had a safety deposit box, they asked me to use the safe in the room. When I informed them the safe was broken, they offered to change my room again, to guess where? My ORIGINAL room with NO AC. -Breakfast was served every morning from 7 to 10 am or something. I checked it out but then opted to have breakfast nearby where there were many local restaurants & hawker stalls that had fresher food. -Towels in the bathroom seemed worn out & dirty -The shower in the bathroom had weak water pressure. -Amenities like soap & shampoo were mediocre, bring your own if you stay here. -Internet costs $$, for our package, it was included & I have to say the internet wifi connection was fast & strong signal, probably because the router was on the ceiling outside my room. - Many Mainland China Tourists were staying on my floor & they are generally loud & the walls of the hotel rooms don't insulate sound quite well. My own room was paid for by the organizer of the event, however for my team athletes, we paid for 2 rooms for them. I feel that for the price we paid, we could have got something much better, but this is Singapore after all.. I am just disappointed & surprised that a hotel of this standard exists in a city like Singapore. I gave 2 dots for my rating because of the friendly & helpful hotel manager Mr Jason. Otherwise, I would give one dot.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel during conference!”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oxford Hotel during a 1 week conference I had in March. The hotel is located really well not far away from the National Museum, Singapore Art Museum and Little India. The MRT station is just 300 yards away. The room rates are very affordable, breakfast in the morning was really good and the hotel staff was nice and helpful. Overall a great hotel to stay at...i´ll definetly come back when I´m in Singapore!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: george_d_traveler
Reviews.Content: As a traveler, my travel buddy and i have stayed at the best and the worst hotels. Oxford hotel, despite its good location, is UNACCEPTABLE, UNHYGIENIC, and was the worst hotel (if it even deserves to be called a 'hotel') we've ever stayed at. Rooms were awful, It was dirty, carpets were stained, walls looked even worse than the building's exterior ones. As for safety, there is only one person at the Lobby in the evening. There is only one elevator, with only 8 (eight) floors to cover, and yet you have to wait FOREVER to reach your floor. The breakfast is served cold all the time. It does not matter what time we go down to have breakfast, they're always served cold. One cannot get any decent sleep in this hotel. Just as one is about to go into deep slumber you can hear people banging on the walls in the other room, people going in and out of the room, loud music, and people screaming. (at 2AM??)

Reviews.Title: “Plain Vanilla Hotel with convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TrotGlobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extended business trip (~3 weeks). Room was small but cozy with study table and complimentary internet (which was very useful). Sometimes lighting seemd to be insufficient. Bathroom was decent. Breakfast choices were basic. More international choices could have been better. Basically hotel primaily caters to Chinese tourist groups. Situated at the heart of the city with walking distance from MRT stations and bus stops. Absence of other activities at hotel was missed (like swimming pool/ gym etc).

Reviews.Title: “in a budget”
Reviews.Author: icymargie
Reviews.Content: if you are in a budget the hotel is in a nice location near the train station, orchard street and chimes. The breakfast is ok its the same everyday fried rice, boiled eggs, beans and so on it taste nice. The main problem is there room we occupied two rooms the room of my aunt and her son is ok its clean and well a bit small for 3 people while our room is bigger but there is this disgusting odor that every time we came in its there and we need to open the window so it will disappear and the bed of my uncle has also that odor so the three of us end up sleeping in one bed because of that and there wifi has a fee 2 Singaporean dollars per hour. if i will go back again?? i think not.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for Central Location - Go for it or else!!”
Reviews.Author: nabarunr
Reviews.Content: The first thing that hits you is the tall matchbox like building which is as colourful like the city. The service at the front desk is swift, but if you are lucky then you'rs special request will be heard (asked for a adaptor for the plug - never heard back from them!!). The rooms are really small with a very small toilet & shower sqeezed in. The best thing about this Hotel is its location, which is near to a number of tourist attractions (like the Musuam, Arts Centre, Raffels Sq) and if you are adventerous enough to try the local metro/sub the Bras Basha MRT/Metro station is right there within 50 mts. The Hotel do have a restrurent - which is highly avoidable since there are numerous food coutrts and joints across this area. The famous Bugis Red Dot Market is within the walking distance. The breakfast is one of the worst I have found in any such Hotels - you have to manage with a very standard one with No/Little choice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised.. Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: thea_imutz
Reviews.Content: As a trip advisor fans, I always check reviews for hotels I would stay in. So, I could be prepared of anything that might make me uncomfortable during my stay. My office booked me this hotel. Prior to departure, I checked reviews for this hotel on trip advisor. The reviews were not good.. But surprised for me, the reviews were wrong. The hotel was renovated. I stayed on the 8th floor, standard non-smoking room. The bed was comfy, no stains. The shower and toilet were nice. The aircon also cool.. The breakfast were okay for me. So, I did feel comfy during 5 nights of my stay. One thing that I felt uncovenient was the smell of the paint, was still too strong. But, I definitely recommend this hotel. The location is so strategic, either for a business or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location under budget”
Reviews.Author: sanjeev1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the central location just walking distance from Orchard Road. The room rates are nominal as per the amenities of the hotel. I will give 2 out of 5 rating. If you are there for shopping and sight-seeing then definitely the best hotel under budget with the best amenities and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good substitute”
Reviews.Author: arcueid
Reviews.Content: Since my only concern was place to sleep at, a private bathroom, and a place where I can safely leave our bags, I'm just glad they still had an available room at a very late notice (..like near midnight notice). The room had the things I needed.. though I wasn't sure if it was ghosts or it's just really that noisy outside the room.. The opening and closing of doors never end and you always hear lots of noisy people talking =,= The food was okay, it was free anyway. The elevator was cramped, funny and scary. Funny and at the same time scary 'cause of the way it stops... There were cheaper, nicer hotels but this was the nearest hotel that had an available room for 3.. so yay! Would I recommend it? yeah sure. if they don't have any other choice.

Reviews.Title: “JUST BASIC AMENITIES”
Reviews.Author: whirlwindexplorer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a central location but offers just basic facilities. Some of the rooms are not very well maintained and have a worn-out look. Rather cramped feeling. Even the breakfast buffet is just functional, with no frills whatsoever. Not exactly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Worst Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bts1027
Reviews.Content: I knew we made the wrong decision to stay at this hotel when we saw our room - the carpet was dirty, the bathroom needed to be re-grouted, the aircon wasn't working, among others. We complained about the aircon not working, then went out for a good 4 hours. By the time we came back, the maintenance staff were busy watching football on TV, the room smelled of chemicals and they made a mess in the bathroom. If I hadn't raised my voice at the receptionist who insisted that we stayed in the same room, they wouldn't have transferred us to another room - which was not any better ... bathroom light wasn't working, the TV seemed to be running on diesel as it took sometime to power on, carpet was just as dirty, and the list goes on and on. Stay away from this hotel ... never again!

Reviews.Title: “nice outside but inside is rotten”
Reviews.Author: Davaoeno
Reviews.Content: I have a very high regard of singapore as a country (the best in asia, one of the best in the world), clean and orderly city, disciplined people etc. not until I stayed in the worst hotel I had ever stayed in my life, not even in a third world and developing counrty. I don"t mind if the room is small for as long as it is clean. The beddings are old and with all the stains, the floor carpet is dirty, was so yakky to walk barefoot, . the smell of the room is so bad and the airconditioner is emmiting more bad odor, the wall is delapidated and the bed mattress is sagging, the cr is crampy and smelly too etc. I felt so ashamed with my family as this trip was my surprise present to them. I need to talk to my travel agent one of these days and will complain. The worst hotel i have ever stayed and I can not believe that such a hotel is allowed in Singapore whose government is so strict when it comes to cleanliness. I once complimented a taxi driver that you have such a nice and clean city, and he answered, nice outside but inside is rotten (I never asked why) and now .. I guess i got him and I believe him so. A very disappointed guest from the philippines.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it”
Reviews.Author: dianella1
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with Hotel it is certainly a two star hotel. The rooms are quite small and shabby did not meet my expectations. The staff were nice and that is the only good thing about this hotel. Linda Lawson

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Jaimeapo
Reviews.Content: Just to have somewhere to sleep... the breakfast wasn't special, but the location was perfect to walk around. i think it was quite too expensive for this type of installations.

Reviews.Title: “Blood and fecal stained sheets and towels!”
Reviews.Author: jknyc1982
Reviews.Content: The Oxford hotel is horrific. I by no means need to stay at a fancy hotel. But this hotel is beyond words. The health department needs to shut down the place down. The pillows, sheets and towels had all sorts of stains. Most recognizable were blood and fecal matter stains on them. When I asked for the sheets and towels to be changed the changed set were worse than the originals. The bed and room was infested with bugs. I tried to rough it out but I had to check out after I saw the blood stain. I checked out after the 2nd night because I started to feel very ill and became very worried about my health. I cannot even rate this hotel because it is worse than One star. I would highly recommend to find another hotel. For the same price I checked into the Hotel Royal Queens across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: dreamy_traveler
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise and my travel agent booked us at this hotel the night before and after the 7-day cruise. The cruise itself was already pricey so to cut on cost, we said it's okay to be booked in a regular hotel. Well, we got what we requested for. It was such a regular hotel or should I say, an inn! The rooms are so small and badly needed a renovation. The bed and the beddings, oh my goodness. The towels are even worse!!! It was fortunate we're just staying for a few hours!!! We don't stay there actually. We just go out and go somewhere! It'll be so agonizing to stay there. Their television has 3 channels only, I think and it's not even an English show being televised. Ayay-yay!!! The hallway is too small and old smelling. The staff, one question one answer! The breakfast buffet was decent but so ordinary. I'd only go one round and that's it. I'm just so relieved to be in the luxury cruise ship. I dreaded the day when the cruise ended meaning we're going back to Oxford. When we got out of the ship, went back to the hotel, just dropped our luggages, went shopping till the midnight, went back to the hotel again just to pack, sleep for just 6 hours, bath (but used my own towel), packed again and checked out. Left our things at the small lobby, went out again and just came back in time for the airport pick-up!!! From now on, I'm not telling our agent to book us at a regular hotel!!! I'ts a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: gcfranco
Reviews.Content: I'm not a luxurious traveler but I know a good, clean and efficient boutique hotel when I see one. But Oxford is far from that. The upside, location is clean, quiet and is surrrounded by churches, and there is an art museum nearby. Chimes is also a 5 mintue walk. If the new mrt station nearby opens, locations becomes perfect! Some staff are courteous. Now the downside, this hotel needs a quick refurbishment. Some receptionist are not accommodating. The next hawkers eatery is about 10-15 mintues away to Bugis Junction. Complaints are not acted quickly. Breakfast needs variety. No bellboy. My room landline was not working, my singaporean friend needed to complain about it for me before it was acted on. The Queens At Central hotel on the opposite side looks better.

Reviews.Title: “A Pretty poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skyelander174
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the hotel on a Sunday to find the keycard entry to my room didn't work and despite being told it would be fixed the next day 4 days later and having to be let in to my room by staff every time I wanted into my room. I forced the issue and was given another room. I must have been lucky compared to others as my room although not spotless was clean and the furniture ok. Half of the staff at reception were helpfull but the other surly and at times down right rude. The area couldn't have been better. Bugis Junction, Raffles Mall, Suntec Centre and Marina Bay just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with bugs and insects and discriminating Mr. Lim(Manager)”
Reviews.Author: nelikks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days on 3/1/09 to 3/3/09. Upon going up to the room we noticed the heavy smell of smoke, insecticide and room freshner. When we tried the air condition as the room was very warm, it was not working. We called the Manager Mr. Lim and told him about the smell of smoke and insecticide and also about the air conditioning not working. He just plainly told us that he did not have another room to move us into. Desperate, and not knowing where and how to get to another hotel, we decided to stay. The whole night was very uncomfortable-insect bites which gave me and my wife and friend red rushes all over our bodies!!! When we could not bear it we threatened to blog their hotel and complain to the travel agency which booked us for refund and finally the next day, we were moved. This time when I took a shower in the bathroom, the shower holder of portable shower head fell on me narrowly missing my eye!!!! To be fair the hotel is in a proximity to most services, but i warn you, the hotel caters dicriminatingly to chinese clientele-from yjr breakfast buffet to room assignments- if you are not this, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!YOU WILL BE SORRY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing and a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Luckyinchina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our two young children. Have booked it, having read a confusingly favorable review in the Rough Guide - admittedly, an outdated version. The plate in the lobby informs that the hotel had been nominated for a hotel award in 2003. One gets a feeling that the hotel managers have given up on it ever since... The dirty curtains in the shabby lobby speak for it all - walk away, there and then! The rooms are small and noisy but it is the half-broken furniture and a filthy bathroom that were most disappointing. We booked on a non-smoking floor but could still feel the cigarette smell. Lastly, some of the clientele looked like they should not be around young children. The worst part of the experience still was the price - you can find a much better place to stay in Singapore for 180 Singapore dollars. Please don't waste your money on this pace!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: TigerL103
Reviews.Content: I am not the luxury traveler, but I am used to finding quality budget hotels. Singapore is full of boutique and other more value oriented hotels. When I arrived, they had booked me in a smoking room and I fear what that one would have been like had I not changed rooms. I was given a "just freshened" room on one of the two non smoking floors. I walk in to find - shoe marks on my pillow, hairs and other items on the bed, the comforter on the floor in the closet, some foreign yellowish-brown substance that had dried on the wall, scuff marks on the fraying towels, mildew and the previous guests long hair on the walls of the shower, the TV didn't work and the air con wouldn't turn off. There is no business center. The free breakfast is small and nothing looks fresh. Save your self the stomach ache and eat at Dome which is right up the block. While the staff is friendly, they have no idea where anything is outside of the hotel. It is in walking distance to many places, but Singapore isn't that large, it is very easy to get around. Queen street is only good for electronics shopping,stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: JAQY
Reviews.Content: The Orchard hotel is just okay... The location is bad because we are very far from Orchard road. The food is almost the same everyday... The rooms are small and not uniform with other room... as if they're trying to make everything fit even if it cannot...But so far our stay was ok

Reviews.Title: “Extra Small Room”
Reviews.Author: verdims
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Oxford for 2 nights. Room is extremely small and bathroom is super small. My knees bump everywhere inside the bathroom. Location is about 20-25 minutes good walk from the nearest MRT station and located in smaller road off the main street. For the price around USD 80, you can get much better hotel (more spacious) in the nearby area (Bugis)

Reviews.Title: “oxford that is ain't comfort”
Reviews.Author: ilovesurewin
Reviews.Content: 'stayed here last holy week break with my family. it was not as bad as i am expecting. the room was kinda small though we were given a suite. i've realized that the front desk staff is very rude. specially the fat chinese girl with the eyeglasses. also when i asked the manager about the toiletries, he said that i should get it in the front desk. what a manager! the breakfast? nothing much being served to us. sausage, fried rice, bread, congee to name a few. if you need a hotel just to sleep and to leave your belongings, then oxford hotel is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “if all you need is a place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: i_am_zim
Reviews.Content: and are not to picky about how your room looks, this is the place for you. from the hotel, its a less than 10min. wak to bugis, city link, marina, and suntec. it's literally at the middle of everything in the city. there is also a new MRT station (bras basah) 4 buildings away... once this becomes operational, the hotel location is perfect. cant say the same about the rooms though. filipinos looking to book this hotel... its like one of lower tier motels. the other reveiwers were right. it was shabby... old carpets, an old tv with no cable, musty smell. at least the toilet was ok. the place really needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God!!”
Reviews.Author: ToonKlang
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, this IS the worst hotel that I ever stayed in my whole life! The room is dirty and cramp! The minute I opened the door, the smell is so strong that I immediately call for change of room, and of course as usual, the staff at reception said all rooms are booked, therefore, no change is allowed. You can see the stain everywhere....the bed sheet, the chairs, the table, curtains, the toilet walls and floor, the carpet...believe me, the stains are everywhere. The room I had got a leaked aircond vent, so I had to change to another in the middle of the night! There is no slippers, no laundry bags, no fridge. Do yourself a favour, pay a little more at Carlton, which is nearby and closer to shops. The staff is so dumb arse that they had no idea or whatsoever is happening to the rooms, all they can say was rooms are fully booked. I had to wait outside at the corridor when the cleaning staff clean up my room at 3.30pm because they forgot despite I had placed the notice early in the morning when I go out. This is a hopeless hotel and I dont think anyone should come back there again since the hotels at Chinatown is about same price but much better in condition.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive”
Reviews.Author: jalanjalan522
Reviews.Content: The room is small, the towels are not clear white even though I ask for a change. It looks like the towels were not washed. Only have a few TV Channels. The immages were not sharp, lost signals quite often. I do not enjoy staying there.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: bloodbubble
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmed reservation at Oxford Hotel for the night of Sept 28 2007 which I had booked through [--]. Upon arriving at the hotel that evening, I was told by the front desk receptionist that the hotel was fully booked for the day and they had to house me in their sister hotel.. which she claimed was "merely 10-15 mins away by cab" What she had failed to tell me (even after I had asked repeatedly) that the sister hotel was located in the East, near Changi Airport, which is a long way out from the city!! The sister hotel, Changi Hotel was a badly run down and old hotel in the middle of nowhere. The experience had ruined my entire trip and I'll definitely stay away from Oxford Hotel on my future trip to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Moldy hotel with cold breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SandP2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has potential, but is not well maintained. Location and the airport car were two saving graces.

Reviews.Title: “What a hole!”
Reviews.Author: grabarwr
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel at random on the internet because the one we usually stay at in Singapore - the Excelsior-had raised their prices dramatically and this was nearby. I suppose I've stayed in worse places - a dollar a night crash pad in New Delhi in 1988 comes to mind - but not in this price range! We ended up staying there three times during our three month trip in Asia but would have left immediately had we not paid in advance and couldn't get our money back. The rooms were all filthy, noisy and the second time we stayed there, reeked of cigarette smoke (despite our having requested a non- smoking room-which they supposedly have-several weeks in advance). The staff were rude and unhelpful.The only positive apart from the location was that the breakfast was okay as long as you got there soon after the hour since the food ran out quickly and they only topped it up once an hour. I can't imagine how this place stays in business and I wouldn't recccomend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Well located, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: EfJay
Reviews.Content: I really found this hotel quite decent at the price in Singapore. We booked at 2 days notice over the phone (our other possiblities were full) and paid the quoted price $140SGD per night all up (including breakfast).The phone conversation mentioned tax extra (which wasnt charged). The room was small but clean and comfortable. Reception were very friendly and there was a happy atmosphere with a number of Asian tour groups coming and going. As previous people have mentioned, I did notice a smoky smell in the corridor on level 9, even though I am a smoker myself - this may well worry a non smoker. The location is excellent - close to cultural historic areas, Orchard Road and both City Hall and Bugis MRT, Orchard Road, Little India an easy walk. Changi bus at end of the street. Certainly I would stay here if you are on a moderate budget and plan to actually go out and see things in Singapore - as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Travellers Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: PiperToronto
Reviews.Content: Word of advice, avoid this hotel at all costs! I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last month during a 3 week trip around India, Malaysia, Japan and of course Singapore and it was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The only good thing about it is the location as mentioned in the other reviews. For the price we paid, it was simply a rip-off. We were given a room upon check-in where the air-conditioning was not working. Given the humid temp in Singapore, this was obviously essential. The bathroom was filthy and water was leaking in from the next suite. We complained and got another room. It was smaller but at least the air-conditioning was working. However, it was only a slight improvement. There were cockroaches in the bathroom and the walls are paper-thin so you can hear people coming and going at all hours during the night. The bedsheets were dirty. As well, it took the maids until 6pm to clean our room! Plus, they didn't even do a thorough job. No tissues were left even though it needed replenshing, the bathroom mirrors, sink and floor were not wiped clean and the bedroom floors were not vacummed. The room safe were not working and nothing was done to fixed it even though we complained. The service was terrible (the receptionists looked annoyed everytime you approached them) and the breakfast was so-so. Nothing to write home about. All in all, we were extremely disappointed with the Oxford hotel. All the other places were already booked, otherwise we would glady had more money for a much cleaner, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “may be passable only if you're a smoker”
Reviews.Author: DavidWW
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel where we could find a room when we arrived in Singapore without a reservation, to find the place almost totally booked out. The room was actually a 'suite' on the 6th floor so I think was probably more roomy than most of the rooms. As soon as the lift doors opened we were almost knocked out by the smell of smoke. The room was no better. Apart from the stench, the room could have been cleaner, the bathroom was grimey and the toilet leaked over the floor. The sound proofing between our room and the next was totally inadequate with loud talking and cupboard doors being banged at 3am. There was no view but we were able to open one window in order to try to get some fresh air, although we stuffed a towell under the door to stop the smell from coming in. Considering there are some great hotels available in Singapore available on the net for less than the full price we paid, we will be making sure we book well ahead next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandJen
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't badly priced but really isn't very nice, honestly. The room was very small, very dark, and I am pretty sure the bed had fleas as my legs were covered in bites - 32 (I count them!!) it is a really good location though, near Raffles and the tube stops, but Singapore isn't that big and this doesn't overcome the poor quality of the hotel. The hotel describes itself as boutique, if you think about the images this conjours up think the exact opposite and you have it - Faulty Towers. We tried to send postcards from reception, we had paid for postage stamps, but they wanted to charge us for putting the postcards in the post!! The also wanted to charge us for booking a taxi for us!! Avoid the tours they offer you can visit the sites for cheaper yourself, taxi's are the chepast transport beating the tube. Breakfast is included but it's not great. Loved our stay in Singapore but it wish we'd stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “quite nice budget hotel (for the price/location)”
Reviews.Author: napalmdog
Reviews.Content: i have read mixed reviews about this hotel. originally, i was planning to stay at Summer View on Bencoolen, but it was fully booked and this was my next best option. before booking here you will have to consider one thing, are you booking on oxford because you want a cheap room on a quiet neighborhood? or are you looking for something that is a bit more classy? if the first one is your main concern then i would suggest staying at this hotel. first of all, the rent is fairly cheap... i paid around 90sgd thru a booking agent that was a "pay to hotel". i know that is still expensive compared to other countries but this is singapore (where everything is more expensive). 2nd, the neighboorhood is quite nice, its right next to churches, museums and a few eateries and is only 5-10mins away from big malls, mrt station and a cinema. also if you are with a loved one, you will probably appreciate the fact that no hookers are to be seen around the vicinity (my one concern on booking at bencoolen) the room was small... but not too small for 2. i could understand tall/big people having problems with this room, but for us asians like me and my gf (im 5'8, she's 5'4), it was enough. we were able to sleep confortably in the bed. we only have 2 small luggages that we put in a corner and was able to move around quite well. i'd recommend the non-smoking floors as they sound to be better than the others (we stayed at the 7th) room felt a bit old, but to me coming from a 3rd world country, its not bad. i could imagine some 1st world people having problems with the room as you would probably have nicer bedrooms than this hehehe. but what are you doing in a budget hotel anyway if you can afford something better? the bathroom is simple, just a glass shower, a bowl and a sink. its adequate for what you need it for. also it comes with soap, shampoo and shower cap, a plus as most budget hotels here only provide an all-in-one bath and body gel. some ants were also seen walking on the corners of the sink which was not really a problem to me. i consider ants as nature's room service :-) the tv is just a small 14", with cable channels (hbo + espn only) and some local channels. i couldnt find the remote though. there is a complimentary coffee and tea maker but we never used it as breakfast was free on the retaurant speaking of breakfast, this is another thing that would sway away caucasians as the selection is mainly asian food. the menu was fried rice, eggs, fried dimsum, congee, toast, butter/jam, pork n beans, hotdogs, fruit and veg salad, coffee and tea. we asians seem to quite enjoy the free breakfast but i saw most caucasians not really having the same as they usually were able to eat only the coffee/tea, toast and egg also be warned that there are no roomboys in this hotel. so dont expect someone to pickup your bags for you, you have to bring it yourself to your room also, i was able to pickup a free wifi signal, just be patient as the signal comes and goes at times. but it was free anyway hehehe to conclude this very lengthy review, i would recommend oxford to those with a small budget looking for a clean, decent room. especially if your main reason in singapore is to go around the tourist spots and shop, as you will just probably need a nice and clean place to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jetsetbaby
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 (and 1 infant) stayed in 3 different hotels due to our first preference (The City Bayview Hotel) being fully booked. For the price, Oxford is just okay. The rooms are very small, with barely enough room for the double bed in it. there's a small TV in the room and that's it. It's passably clean but feels old. The first room given to us smelled terribly of mould, but the receptionists were friendly and quickly changed the room. The second room still had a musty smell, but it was a large improvement over the first room. In the end, our friends only stayed in the hotel for 1 night instead of the original 3 planned because they were hefty guys and the room was just too gloomy and small. They ended up moving to the Hotel 81 Bencoolen. The room there was just a little bigger but was much newer and cleaner and the hotel was closer to the City Bayview Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel- Too expensive and bad service.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNottingham
Reviews.Content: We didnt know where to stay and Singapore - the taxi driver took us to this hotel ( thinking that it was cheap- but nice). At first, we found the staff very unfriendly - we asked them to see the room before paying , but they said "NO" and showed us a picture instead. We were so tired - so we decided to stay at the end. When we saw the room we found it very small and very claustrophobic. The window were so close to the bed that you had a feeling that you were going to fall down. All the furniture and bed were so close to one another that it was difficult to walk. One of the main concerns was the poor service from the staff. Breakfast was also very poor quality. AVOID this hotel because you will be 100% dissapointed.
